Re: License #: CB110403982

Dear JILL SCHREUDER:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan must be completed and routed in CWLM. If you desire technical assistance in
addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications; volunteer,
Section contractors on central registry
Description • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Foster Care Worker did not properly do their job as they did not
make reasonable efforts and testified against agency
recommendation. Additionally, Program Director and Human
Resources were aware of these concerns and failed to address
them.
Investigation Interviews:
No phone contact information was provided by Complainant, so
an email was sent to Complainant on 06/10/2025 providing
Complainant with the opportunity to present/provide any additional
information that was not included in the original complaint.
Complainant did not return/respond to email so no additional
information was provided at the time of this report.
I interviewed Program Director by phone on 04/10/2025 and
6/10/2025. Program Director stated Foster Care Worker was on
leave but never returned and was no longer employed by the
agency. Foster Care Worker 2 was assigned to the case along
with Program Manager and Supervisor. Program Director stated
Foster Care Worker 2 reported there had been inaccurate
information provided in the case record including social work
contacts that were alleged but not completed. Program Director
stated the agency conducted an internal review and identified
social work contacts entered by Supervisor that had not occurred.
Program Director stated Supervisor's employment was
subsequently terminated 1/31/2025 due to falsification. Program
Director reported Foster Care Worker 2 and Program Manager
voluntarily left employment with the agency. Program Director
stated that due to recent staff turnover and related circumstances
it was not unexpected that some complaints/allegations may be
made by former staff. The internal review did not identify any
evidence to suggest Foster Care Worker did not make reasonable
efforts or testify against agency recommendations.
I interviewed Human Resources Director by phone on
06/10/2025 who indicated Foster Care Worker, Foster Care
Worker 2, Program Manager, and Supervisor no longer employed
by the agency.
Documents Reviewed:
Personnel information received from Human Resource Director
identified the dates of employment as follows:
Foster Care Worker 2 01/06/25 - 04/09/2025 - voluntary
Foster Care Worker 07/22/24 - 05/12/2025 - voluntary
2

Program Manager 05/07/24 - 03/28/2025 - voluntary
Supervisor 05/28/24 - 01/31/2025 - falsification
The only staff identified as available to consider for re-hire was
Foster Care Worker. Program Director described Supervisor as
not to be considered for re-hire due to the falsification of social
work contacts. Program Director described Foster Care Worker 2
and Program Manager as not to be considered for re-hire due to
the agency’s dissatisfaction with their work performance.
The internal investigation report was received and reviewed. The
internal investigation was initiated 1/14/2025 and completed
1/31/2025. The internal investigation report indicated Supervisor’s
employment was terminated due to falsification of records by
reporting social work contacts in the record that did not occur.
Program Manager was placed on a Performance Improvement
Plan due to mismanagement of staff.
The internal review did not identify any evidence to suggest Foster
Care Worker did not make reasonable efforts or testify against
agency recommendations.
The Initial Service Plan for the period 1/5-2/03/2024, Updated
Service Plans for the periods 2/04-05/03/2024, 5/4-08/01/2024,
8/02-10/21/2024, 10/22/2024-01/19/2025, and 1/20-4/17/2025
were all reviewed. Social work contacts and other documentation
included in these reports indicated reasonable efforts were being
completed by the case managers and staff of the agency.
I reviewed agency court reports dated 2/26/2024, 6/05/2024,
8/21/2024, and 1/02/2025. The information in these reports was
also consistent with determining reasonable efforts on the part of
the agency.
I reviewed court findings dated 1/5/24, 3/4/24, 3/13/24,
3/21/24,6/20/24, 6/28/24, 8/30/24, 11/05/24, 11/22/24,
12/06/2024, 1/06/25, 2/03/25, and 4/30/2025. The contents of
these court findings were consistent with reasonable efforts being
determined or not being required per MCL 722.638(1). The court
findings determined the children should be returned to the mother
consistent with the 1/06/2025 court order with discharge from
court jurisdiction following the 4/30/2025 hearing.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance per interviews that were
completed and documents that were reviewed. The interviews
that were completed with Program Director and Human
Resources Director determined that whatever else may have
3

occurred in the supervision and case management, Supervisor
was identified as providing false social work contacts associated
with this case management. The internal investigation by the
agency substantiated the concerns that were reported were
investigated. The findings of the internal investigation, case
management and court records reviewed did not substantiate
mismanagement on the part of Foster Care Worker.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
07/1/2025
______________________________________
Mark Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
